result.execSummary:
The defendant Raheem Demoney Winston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with 11 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court allows dosage probation.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs. Random urine screens.
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. Court stayed commencement until 01/08/2015 at 5pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raheem Demoney Winston

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (27 pages) commencing  01/04/2016 received and filed.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packets
1/11/16 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS with 11 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1.5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.  Court allows dosage probation.

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 30 days condition time with Huber.  Court stayed commencement until 01/08/2015 at 5pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Sentence Referral Form
Letters in Support of the Defendant
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Ineligible Voting Notice received and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however defense attorney is in trial in another branch.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed on 5/27/2015.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.  aw

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests a status date.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  State has filed a motion to join all three cases for trial.  Court stated Judge Witkowiak will rule on the joinder motion.  A substitution was previously filed.  Case is now assigned to Judge Witkowiak, branch 22.  Clerk contacted Judge Watts for the next court date.  Case adjourned for status on 8/24/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 22.  aw  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Court adds that the defendant be monitored at ENHANCED supervision with Justice Point with drug testing, no drug paraphernalia, and no firearms or dangerous weapons.  No possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson. Ron Dague for Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
   Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Joel Susler.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
